title: Setting up a SvelteKit project with Storybook
description: Setting up Storybook on a SvelteKit project doesn't work out of the box using the config tool. This guide walks you through a few extra steps needed to get SvelteKit and Storybook running.

title: Avocado toast
description: Perhaps the icon of a generation, avocado toast is a delicious and nutritious way to start the day.

title: Price Elasticity of Demand (PED)
description: Price changes impact the demand for goods and services. PED is a microeconomics tool for quantifyng that impact.

title: Present three options to build consensus
description: Cognitive biases lead people to evaluate options in context. There are strong biases that impact decision making when there are one or two options.

title: Single-option aversion bias
description: People are biased against deciding on a single option. Multiple options enable people to compare and make informed decisions.

title: Seattle area cafÃ©s I like
description: A curated list of my favorite Seattle area cafes to sit, sip, and relax or work.

title: Restaurants I like
description: A list of some of my favorite places to get a meal in the Seattle area.

title: Money market
description: The market for currency and the mechanics that govern it, such as interest rates, money supply, and the required reserve ratio.

title: Microeconomics
description: An overview of my notes on microeconomics.

title: Costs of production
description: Understanding the costs facing a business is an important part of evaluating its profitability. There are two categories of costs - fixed and variable.

title: Opportunity cost
description: The most valuable alternative that must be given up.

title: Price elasticity
description: Price elasticity measures how much the demand for a good changes in response to price changes.

title: Consumer demand
description: Consumer demand looks at the three types of relationships between goods and how price changes to one product affects demand for another.

title: Cross-Price Elasticity of Demand (CPED)
description: Microeconomics tool for quantifying the change in demand for a product in response to price changes for substitute goods.

title: Marginal utility
description: The incremental value gained from have one more of something.

title: Market forces
description: The factors that impact the price of goods and services, which in turn drives supply and demand changes.

title: Supply and demand
description: An area of microeconomics focused on how price influences the behavior of producers and consumers.

title: Great UI shadows imitate real shadows
description: UI shadows should create an illusion of depth. For the best illusion, imitate reality.

title: The principal-agent problem
description: When there is a conflict in priorities between one party (the principal) and another party (the agent) that executions on their behalf.

title: Grapow
description: Grapow is a sweet & spicy Thai dish made with ground meat, Thai chilis, and Thai basil. This dish is often requested by friends joining for dinner.

title: Value innovation
description: Value innovation is how companies offer dramatically higher value at lower costs, escaping competition.

title: Use contrast to direct attention
description: Visual focus is naturally drawn to contrast. Use contrast in design to direct attention.

title: Make hard decisions quickly
description: The less differentiated the options are, the harder it is to choose one.

title: Type-1 and Type-2 Decisions
description: A decision dichotomy based on if the decision can be mitigated or reversed.

title: Ask, don't tell
description: Giving unprompted advice is ineffective. Instead, lead people to ask for advice.

title: Vicious and virtuous cycles
description: Self-reinforcing cycles that act as compound growth systems. Negative cycles are vicious, positive cycles are virtuous.

title: Categories of customer attributes
description: Customer attributes can be grouped as demographic, psychographic, geographic, or behavior.

title: The fundamental habits
description: These simple behaviors are often challenging, but provide a rock solid foundation for the rest of life.

title: Utility
description: Utility is the microeconomics concept for how much satisfaction, pain reduction, happiness, or value a buyer gets from a product or service.

title: Blue Ocean
description: Blue oceans are markets that haven't been created yet. They are lucrative business opportunities.

title: Segmentation, Targeting, and Positioning (STP)
description: Group consumers into segments, determine which to target, and estable the product's position for them.

title: Common traits of successful blue ocean strategies
description: Great strategies have a clear focus, diverge from competition, and are easy to explain.

title: Value curve
description: The line on a strategy canvas showing the emphasis a company places on each factor of competition in its industry.

title: Blue Ocean strategy
description: Blue ocean strategy is about creating new markets to escape competition.

title: Factors of competition
description: The factors that companies/products within an industry typically compete on to provide value to customers.

title: The Four Actions framework
description: Helps identify which factors a business should eliminate, reduce, raise, and create. Typically used with a strategy canvas.

title: The strategy canvas
description: An analytical tool that shows how much emphasis companies place on value areas in their industry.

title: Red ocean
description: Crowded markets where customers have many options to choose from, resulting in cutthroat competition.

title: Business Model Canvas
description: A modern alternative to a business plan. It has 9 sections with details of the business, its customers, and how it provides value.

title: Customer relationship
description: The interactions a business has with customers and the strategies around those interactions.

title: Value proposition
description: The way(s) a product or service benefits its target customers and the statement describing it.

title: Build infrastructure after not having it becomes painful
description: The pain caused by a lack of infrastructure proves the infrastructure is necessary.

title: Distribution channel
description: Distribution channels are how products and services get from a business to its customers.

title: Monetized content creation is a compound growth system
description: New content creates new organic inbound traffic and retains the audience. Old content creates more value from new audience.

title: Compound growth is most impactful at the end
description: Compound growth is exponential. Each compounding period generates more growth than the previous one.

title: Compound growth system
description: Any system in which growth is proportional to the principal, added to that principal, and then repeated.

title: Customer segment
description: The groups of people a business aims to serve.

title: Positioning statement
description: An explanation of how a product fits into its market.

title: Situation analysis
description: A tool for identifying and evaluating the market conditions for a product or service.

title: The learning process
description: A repeating cycle of receiving input, processing it to create output, evaluating that output, and evaluating results to improve future processing.

title: My spaced repetition workflow
description: The setup and workflow I use to retain what I learn and deepen my understanding.

title: The world is recursive
description: The same things happen across domains and contexts all over the world. Very little is unique or novel.

title: Give mostly positive feedback
description: Both positive and negative feedback are important, but on high performing teams positive feedback outweighs constructive feedback 5 to 1.
